# VZBridgedNetworkDeviceAttachment

**Class**

A network device that interacts directly with a physical network interface on the host computer.

## Declaration

```swift
class VZBridgedNetworkDeviceAttachment
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZBridgedNetworkDeviceAttachment] object represents a physical interface on the host computer. Use this object when configuring a network interface for your virtual machine. A bridged network device sends and receives packets on the same physical interface as the host computer, but does so using a different network layer.



To configure a network device with a bridged network interface:

1. Obtain a reference to one of the hostâ€™s physical network interfaces from the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZBridgedNetworkInterface/networkInterfaces] property of [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZBridgedNetworkInterface].
2. Create the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZBridgedNetworkDeviceAttachment] object using the network interface.
3. Assign the attachment object to the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZNetworkDeviceConfiguration/attachment] property of a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioNetworkDeviceConfiguration] object.
4. Add the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioNetworkDeviceConfiguration] object to the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachineConfiguration/networkDevices] property of your [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachineConfiguration].

## Creating the attachment point

- **init(interface:)**: Creates the attachment from a bridged network interface object.

## Getting the network interface

- **interface**: The network interface assigned to this attachment.

## Attachment points

- **VZFileHandleNetworkDeviceAttachment**: A network device that transmits raw network packets and frames using a datagram socket.
- **VZNATNetworkDeviceAttachment**: A device that routes network requests through the host computer and performs network address translation on the resulting packets.
- **VZVmnetNetworkDeviceAttachment**: A network device attachment that allows a custom network topology.
- **VZNetworkDeviceAttachment**: The common behaviors for the network attachment points of your virtual machine.

## Inherits From

- VZNetworkDeviceAttachment

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
